4 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the historical average price for a specific cryptocurrency based on its unique identifier and a specific date.

5 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the historical price data for a specific cryptocurrency on a particular exchange.

This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of supported exchanges

This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of tickers for a specific cryptocurrency across different exchanges.

1 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of supported blockchains by CoinStats

40 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the balance data for a provided wallet address on a specific blockchain network

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of connection, which you received from /wallet/blockchains call response.

get.description:
40 credits per request
Credits 40 per network, This endpoint allows you to retrieve the balance data for a provided wallet address on an all CoinStats Supported networks

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The wallet address for which the balance is being queried. Must be a valid string representing an EVM-compatible wallet address.

parameters.name: networks
parameters.description: Specifies the blockchain networks to query for the wallet balance. Can be a single network (e.g., "ethereum") or a comma-separated list of networks (e.g., "ethereum,polygon,binance"). If not provided, the default is "all" supported networks.

get.description:
3 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the syncing status of the wallet with the blockchain network

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of connection, which you received from /wallet/blockchains call response.

409.description: Transactions not synced. Please call PATCH /transactions

get.description:
40 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve transaction data for a specific wallet. Ensure transactions are synced by calling PATCH /transactions first.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Please include the date in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Please include the date in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of connection, which you received from /wallet/blockchains call response.

coinData.description: Only sent if there is at least 1 coin in transactions

profitLoss.description: Only sent if there is at least 1 coin in transactions

id.description: Sent only when fee is another transaction object

409.description: Transactions not synced. Please call PATCH /transactions

patch.description:
80 credits per request
This endpoint initiates the syncing process to update transaction data for a specific wallet. By making a PATCH request to this endpoint and providing the wallet address as a parameter, you can trigger the syncing process and retrieve the latest transaction data for the wallet.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of connection, which you received from /wallet/blockchains call response.

1 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of fiat currencies supported by CoinStats

2 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of trending Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) in the marketplace. Trending NFTs typically represent the most popular or highly sought-after digital assets based on sales volume

40 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of NFT assets owned by a specific wallet address.

3 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve an NFT collection info with a specific collection address.

8 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of NFT assets associated with a specific NFT collection address.

5 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve information about a specific NFT asset based on the NFT collection address and token ID

coinId.description: Coin ID from CoinStats API. For fiats you can send coin ID like this: FiatCoinUSD.

count.description: Amount of coin. For sell transactions, this should be negative.

date.description: Transaction date in milliseconds. If not provided, current date will be used.

price.description: Price of coin in USD at the time of transaction.

portfolioId.description: If shared portfolio is not manual portfolio, then this field is required.

get.description:
1 credits per request
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of fiat currencies supported by CoinStats.

tags.name: Market Data
tags.description: The Market Data section of the API provides endpoints to access a wide range of market-related information, including cryptocurrency coins, ticker data, and fiat currency rates. This category offers comprehensive data to help users monitor and analyze the cryptocurrency market, track prices, and gain insights into market trends

tags.name: News
tags.description: The News section of the API allows you to access news articles and updates related to cryptocurrencies and the blockchain industry. It provides valuable information from various sources to keep you informed about the latest developments

tags.name: NFTs
tags.description: The NFT section of the API provides endpoints to interact with Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), which are unique digital assets stored on a blockchain. These endpoints allow you to retrieve information about NFTs, including collections, assets, trending NFTs, and specific assets associated with wallet addresses.

tags.name: Wallet Data
tags.description: The Wallet section of the API provides a comprehensive set of endpoints to manage and interact with wallets. It enables users to retrieve wallet balances, monitor syncing status, fetch transaction data, and synchronize wallet information with the blockchain. By integrating these endpoints into your application, you can offer robust wallet functionality to your users.

tags.name: Exchange Connection
tags.description: The Exchange Connection section of the API provides a comprehensive set of endpoints to manage and interact with exchanges. It enables users to retrieve exchange balances, monitor syncing status, fetch transaction data. By integrating these endpoints into your application, you can offer robust exchange portfolio tracking functionality to your users.

tags.name: Portfolio
tags.description: The Portfolio section of the API provides a comprehensive set of endpoints to manage and interact with Share Portfolios. It enables users to retrieve current Portfolio Coins and Transactions.

X-API-KEY.name: X-API-KEY
X-API-KEY.description: API key needed to access the endpoints. Example: 'demo-api-key'
